content:
• Wednesday, December 5, 2012
  • VRA

    More on Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA): Q3 results beat on all counts on a 14% Y/Y jump in total...

    More on Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA): Q3 results beat on all counts on a 14% Y/Y jump in total sales. Net earnings climbed 37% as same-store sales and margins strengthened. However, the company offered downbeat Q4 guidance, now projecting earnings of $0.55 to $0.57 a share and revenue of $147M to $152M. Analysts were looking ofr $0.60 on $160M, respectively. Shares -10.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 PM | 4 Comments
  • BHP

    Speculation continues to build on rumors that BHP Billiton (NYSE:BHP) is considering a bid for...

    Speculation continues to build on rumors that BHP Billiton (NYSE:BHP) is considering a bid for Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT). BHP is said to be considering a $55 per share all cash offer, and if true, would be the "swan song" for current WLT CEO Marius Kloppers, whom which BHP is said to be planning a successor for. Xtrata's Mick ‘the miner’ Davis is said to be a frontrunner to take his place. BHP -0.2%, WLT -2.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • DCTH

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH) says it's seeking FDA approval for a narrower use than originally...

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH) says it's seeking FDA approval for a narrower use than originally expected for its new liver cancer drug, based on the agency's guidance. The company said it's now seeking to focus its new chemosaturation system on just treating patients with inoperable metastatic ocular melanoma in the liver, a rare form of cancer that generally begins as a melanoma of the eye, rather than to use the drug to treat other forms of melanoma in the liver as well. Shares -11% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:28 PM
  • KAR

    Kar Auction (NYSE:KAR) prices its 13.5M share secondary offering at $17.50, a 3.5% discount to...

    Kar Auction (NYSE:KAR) prices its 13.5M share secondary offering at $17.50, a 3.5% discount to the close. Credit Suisse and Goldman acted as joint book running managers for the offering. Shares +1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM
  • TLRD

    Men's Wearhouse (MW): Q3 EPS of $0.95 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $630.1M in-line. Shares -9%...

    Men's Wearhouse (MW): Q3 EPS of $0.95 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $630.1M in-line. Shares -9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:21 PM
  • GRMN

    Garmin (NASDAQ:GRMN) is being added to the S&P 500 as of the Dec. 11 close. The PND maker...

    Garmin (NASDAQ:GRMN) is being added to the S&P 500 as of the Dec. 11 close. The PND maker will be kicking out R.R. Donnelley (NASDAQ:RRD), which is joining the S&P MidCap 400. RRD has had a tough year, punctuated by declining demand for printing services and an embarrassing mishap related to Google's Q3 report. GRMN +4.5% AH. RRD -0.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM
  • UEPS

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: UEPS +6.9%. GRMN +4.5%. MAS +3.9%. CTRP +3.7%. DKS...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: UEPS +6.9%. GRMN +4.5%. MAS +3.9%. CTRP +3.7%. DKS +2.3%.
    After-hours top losers: MW -10.0%. VRA -8.0%. ALGN -4.4%. DNKN -3.4%. ICON -2.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • CKSW

    ClickSoftware (CKSW +8%) steadily moved higher today after announcing a Swisscom subsidiary that...

    ClickSoftware (CKSW +8%) steadily moved higher today after announcing a Swisscom subsidiary that handles network infrastructure projects will use its Mobility Suite to manage field engineer schedules. ClickSoftware shares are well off their March/April highs. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • MEMP

    Memorial Production Partners (NASDAQ:MEMP) -5.8% AH after announcing a public offering of 10.5M...

    Memorial Production Partners (NASDAQ:MEMP) -5.8% AH after announcing a public offering of 10.5M common units representing limited partner interests. MEMP intends to use the net proceeds to fund a portion of the purchase price for its pending acquisition of oil and natural gas properties.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • FNSR

    More on Finisar: FQ3 guidance is for revenue of $230M-$245M and EPS of $0.14-$0.18, in-line with...

    More on Finisar: FQ3 guidance is for revenue of $230M-$245M and EPS of $0.14-$0.18, in-line with a consensus of $239.5M and $0.17 and better than feared in light of capex worries. The company says demand for its tunable transceivers, ROADM line cards, and optical switching components drove Q/Q growth. Gross margin was 30.5%, up 20 bps Q/Q. FNSR +5% AH. JDSU +0.7%. Needham's upgrade was well-timed. CC at 5PM ET (webcast).Â  (PR) (slides - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • PRA

    Pro-Assurance (NYSE:PRA) declares $0.25/share regular quarterly dividend and $2.50/share special...

    Pro-Assurance (NYSE:PRA) declares $0.25/share regular quarterly dividend and $2.50/share special dividend. The board announced 2 for 1 stock-split in the form of 100% stock dividend. All the stock action are payable on Dec. 27, to shareholders on record of Dec. 17. Shares +2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • LDOS

    SAIC (SAI): Q3 EPS of $0.33 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $2.87B (+3% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.9%...

    SAIC (SAI): Q3 EPS of $0.33 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $2.87B (+3% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • AMBA

    Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA): Q3 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $35.7M (+24% Y/Y) beats by...

    Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA): Q3 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $35.7M (+24% Y/Y) beats by $1.3M. Shares +1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • ASNA

    Ascena Retail Group (NASDAQ:ASNA): FQ1 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.14B (+48% Y/Y)...

    Ascena Retail Group (NASDAQ:ASNA): FQ1 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.14B (+48% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • VRA

    Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA): Q3 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $138.3M (+14.2% Y/Y) beats...

    Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA): Q3 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $138.3M (+14.2% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares -3.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • FNSR

    Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR): FQ2 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $232M (+6% Y/Y) in-line....

    Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR): FQ2 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $232M (+6% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • HON

    Honeywell (HON +1.8%) moves up today after Stifel Nicolaus initiated the shares with a Buy and a...

    Honeywell (HON +1.8%) moves up today after Stifel Nicolaus initiated the shares with a Buy and a target price of $72 a share. The firm also added the stock to its Select List, citing its strong business portfolio and product development.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • WHF

    WhiteHorse Finance (NASDAQ:WHF) - the business development company (BDC) subsidiary of...

    WhiteHorse Finance (NASDAQ:WHF) - the business development company (BDC) subsidiary of H.I.G. Capital - finally opens for trade after raising $100M in its IPO. "Human error" at the Nasdaq led to the postponement of trade until this afternoon. Shares are at $13.98, -6% from the IPO price.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Coal stocks are strong following reports China’s new leadership pledged to promote...

    Coal stocks are strong following reports China’s new leadership pledged to promote domestic demand and urbanization with wider policy support for economic recovery. China relies heavily on coal for power generation. ANR +10.6%, ACI +7.7%, WLT +6.7%, CNX +5%, BTU +4.7%. KOL +2.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 10 Comments
  • AIQUF

    Airgas (ARG +0.5%) is holding its 2012 analyst meeting today, during which it will discuss...

    Airgas (ARG +0.5%) is holding its 2012 analyst meeting today, during which it will discuss strategies for growth, operating efficiency opportunities, the progress of the Company's SAP implementation, and fiscal 2016 financial goals. CFO Robert McLaughlin noted in an earlier statement that: "While near-term business conditions are challenging, we expect to have grown revenues to more than $6.5B, increased operating margins to between 15% and 16%, and expanded return on capital to between 17% and 18%." (Webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • EGC

    Shares of Energy XXI (EXXI +7.3%), McMoRan's (NYSE:MMR) leading minority partner in its...

    Shares of Energy XXI (EXXI +7.3%), McMoRan's (NYSE:MMR) leading minority partner in its ultra-deepwater drilling projects including the troubled Davy Jones well, soar as investors re-calibrate the value of their piece of the pie. Canaccord reiterates its Buy rating on EXXI, citing its oil-weighted asset base, consistent cash generation and potential upside from its ultra-deep program.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • TIBX

    BofA/Merrill has downgraded Tibco (TIBX -20.1%) to Neutral following its FQ4 warning, which has...

    BofA/Merrill has downgraded Tibco (TIBX -20.1%) to Neutral following its FQ4 warning, which has led shares to plunge to new 52-week lows. Piper sees the warning as another sign of "pervasively deteriorating conditions for on-premise software companies." The Street seems to agree a bit: QLIK -4.2%. INFA -5%. ORCL -1.8%. RHT -1.4%. CTXS -1.7%. Wedbush argues Tibco's long-term growth story is intact - Tibco noted in its warning demand for its Spotfire analytics platform remains strong.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • ADTN

    Adtran (ADTN -4.5%) is off after receiving a downgrade to Sell from Citi, which cites...

    Adtran (ADTN -4.5%) is off after receiving a downgrade to Sell from Citi, which cites "challenges" in the company's wireline access business. That business has strong exposure to legacy technologies such as T1 and T3 lines, as well as to the soft wireline capex budgets of U.S. carriers. Adtran tumbled in September and October on poor guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • EDU

    Shares of New Oriental Education (EDU -4.8%) slump futher, extending a two-day decline. A...

    Shares of New Oriental Education (EDU -4.8%) slump futher, extending a two-day decline. A decision by the SEC to step up regulationh of Chinese subsidiaries of U.S. accounting firms appears to be weighing heavy on the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • WDC

    Western Digital (WDC +8.4%) and Seagate (STX +4.6%) are up strongly in the absence of major news...

    Western Digital (WDC +8.4%) and Seagate (STX +4.6%) are up strongly in the absence of major news hitting the wires. WDC announced yesterday morning it would accelerate a dividend payment, but shares hardly budged in response. Low valuations - the hard drive makers both trade near 5x estimated FY13 EPS, and have sizable cash balances - could be enticing bargain-hunters. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 4 Comments
  • KITD

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +4.6%) has rallied to $0.74 on news ex-chairman/CEO Kaleil Isaza Tuzman...

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +4.6%) has rallied to $0.74 on news ex-chairman/CEO Kaleil Isaza Tuzman (previous) has offered to buy the company for $1.35-$1.70/share. Tuzman had offered $3.75/share in November in a deal that would've required P-E support, but few expected that bid to remain following the bloodbath KIT shares saw last month on news it's restating results and running out of cash.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP -1.9%) cites new risk factors in an updated SEC filing (10-Q) beyond just its...

    J.C. Penney (JCP -1.9%) cites new risk factors in an updated SEC filing (10-Q) beyond just its ability to hold on to key talent. Sharp analysis of the filing reveals the retailer added the words "access to our credit facility" to a previously-issued paragraph on its cash flow outlook.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM | 6 Comments
  • C

    The market just doesn't exist at this time, says Citigroup (NYSE:C) CFO John Gerspach at the...

    The market just doesn't exist at this time, says Citigroup (NYSE:C) CFO John Gerspach at the Goldman investor conference (presentation, webcast), dashing investor hopes the bank can pick up the phone and be relieved of its bad assets. "Ain't no way, no how we can get out of our crappy mortgages, so stop asking," paraphrases Fortune's Stephen Gandel. Shares +6.3% on back of the cost saving news.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • FCX

    Dahlman Rose analysts say that while Freeport (FCX -13.8%) investors, who viewed the company as...

    Dahlman Rose analysts say that while Freeport (FCX -13.8%) investors, who viewed the company as a copper play, may look down on today's deal, the miner's balance sheet will better enable the expensive development of Plains' (PXP +25.2%) deepwater fields as well as McMoRan's (MMR +82.4%) Davy Jones prospect. The firm reiterates its Buy rating and $45 price target on FCX.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 3 Comments
  • TTC

    Shares of Toro (TTC -3%) slide after its FQ4 top line result missed estimates this morning. Net...

    Shares of Toro (TTC -3%) slide after its FQ4 top line result missed estimates this morning. Net earnings dropped 95% as weather conditions hurt the grounds-care equipment maker's sales. The company also lowered guidance for FY13, citing challenges in Europe. It now expects revenue growth to be about 4% to 5%. Earnings are anticipated to be $2.35 - $2.40 per share, below Street estimates of $2.44.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • MMR

    Midday top 10 gainers: MMR +82%. EBOD +69%. MBLX +32%. PXP +26%. UEPS +25%. MITK +23%. AVAV...

    Midday top 10 gainers: MMR +82%. EBOD +69%. MBLX +32%. PXP +26%. UEPS +25%. MITK +23%. AVAV +16%. CYCC +15%. CIE +15%. PLAB +13%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: CHTP -36%. LORL -35%. TIBX -21%. MFRM -21%. ANIK -20%. SINO -19%. BLIN -18%. P -17%. THQI -17%. FIZZ -15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • ACRX

    AcelRx Pharmaceuticals (ACRX -5.3%) slides after announcing a proposed 10M share secondary...

    AcelRx Pharmaceuticals (ACRX -5.3%) slides after announcing a proposed 10M share secondary offering. All of the shares in the offering are to be sold by ACRX. Jefferies and Cowen are acting as joint book-running managers, with Canaccord Genuity acting as co-lead manager.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • CTSH

    Cognizant (CTSH +4.4%) is rallying after disclosing in an 8-K its top execs will be receiving...

    Cognizant (CTSH +4.4%) is rallying after disclosing in an 8-K its top execs will be receiving restricted stock grants tied to "the achievement of certain performance milestones." Oppenheimer sees the disclosure as a sign the IT outsourcing firm will see additional share gains in 2013. Cognizant shares rallied strongly in August and September, but have been range-bound since then.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • ZGNX

    Zogenix (ZGNX -2%) slides after the FDA raises concerns about the abuse potential of its...

    Zogenix (ZGNX -2%) slides after the FDA raises concerns about the abuse potential of its proposed pain pill called Zohydro ER,Â  a long- acting version of hydrocodone, an ingredient typically used in short-acting combination products that are meant to be taken every four-to-six hours. Agency staff noted that Zohydro doesn't contain any abuse-deterrent features to stop people from tampering with the pill to get the hydrocodone out immediately rather than being released over an extended period of time. The product is due be reviewed Friday.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • MM

    Mobile display ad network owner Millennial Media (MM -4.5%) appears to be falling in sympathy...

    Mobile display ad network owner Millennial Media (MM -4.5%) appears to be falling in sympathy with Pandora (P -17.5%), after the latter issued light FQ4 guidance to go with its FQ3 beat, and blamed it advertiser caution about January purchases. Reiterating a Reduce on Pandora, Nomura is concerned the guidance could be a sign of a softening in "new media" ad spending. However, BTIG and Wedbush think company-specific issues are playing a role. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +4.6%) says its net oil and gas sales averaged ~22K boe/day during the...

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +4.6%) says its net oil and gas sales averaged ~22K boe/day during the last two weeks of November. Several of the recent well completions occurred in late Nov.-early Dec., and thus did not materially contribute to stated November oil and gas sales averages. UBS starts coverage of KOG with a Buy rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • MMR

    In its conference call on the purchase of McMoRan (MMR +82.2%) and Plains Exploration (PXP...

    In its conference call on the purchase of McMoRan (MMR +82.2%) and Plains Exploration (PXP +26.1%), Freeport McMoRan's (FCX -13.5%) Richard Adkerson says the deal is an add-on to its mining business and not a diversion from current strategy, and FCX will continue to look for new mining opportunities. With margins and cash flows strong, FCX anticipates continuing its current dividend.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 7 Comments
  • AVAV

    After closing near its 52-week low yesterday, AeroVironment (AVAV +15.9%) is up strongly in...

    After closing near its 52-week low yesterday, AeroVironment (AVAV +15.9%) is up strongly in response to a solid FQ2 beat, which it attributed to a favorable mix and cost savings in addition to strong demand. FY13 guidance is for revenue of $348M-$370M and EPS of $1.41-$1.51, in-line with a consensus of $353.6M and $1.44 and calming investors worried about order push-outs. During the earnings call, management talked up the potential use of AeroVironment's unmanned aircraft in non-military applications, and noted the FAA is developing the necessary rules.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 2 Comments
  • C

    "We were somewhat surprised/pleased by the magnitude," of Citigroup's (C +5.4%) anticipated...

    "We were somewhat surprised/pleased by the magnitude," of Citigroup'sÂ (C +5.4%) anticipated savings, says Wells' Matt Burnell, reacting to the announced job cuts. He reiterates an Outperform, saying the move will accelerate the stock's run towards Citi's $53 in tangible book value.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG -6.5%) has filed a new patent infringement suit against ZTE's U.K. subsidiary; this...

    Vringo (VRNG -6.5%) has filed a new patent infringement suit against ZTE's U.K. subsidiary; this one involves 3 additional patents the company acquired earlier this year from Nokia. Yesterday, Vringo announced its German suit against ZTE is moving forward. (original U.K. suit)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • MIND

    Mitcham Industries (MIND -14%) tanks this morning after its Q3 swung to a surprise loss as...

    Mitcham Industries (MIND -14%) tanks this morning after its Q3 swung to a surprise loss as equipment-leasing revenue sank substantially, dragging down margins. Total revenue dropped by 33% as compared to last year, while gross margin cratered to 23.4% from 51.2%. The company's Latin America business proved to be a bigger drag than anticipated, as activity improved sequentially, but didn't pick up as much as expected due to project delays.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL -3.6%) has sold off in early trading, apparently on news clearing firms are raising...

    Apple (AAPL -3.6%) has sold off in early trading, apparently on news clearing firms are raising their margin requirements for positions due to fears of being too heavily concentrated in the $526B company. One firm, COR Clearing, raised its margin requirement to 60% from 30%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 51 Comments
  • MITK

    Mitek (MITK +22.1%) has soared after announcing U.S. Bank will offer Mitek's Mobile Photo Bill...

    Mitek (MITK +22.1%) has soared after announcing U.S. Bank will offer Mitek's Mobile Photo Bill Pay product, which allows users to make payments by taking a picture of their bill with their smartphone/tablet cameras, to its customers starting in early 2013. Mitek, which had 22% of its float shorted as of Nov. 15, has seen its shares crushed this year thanks in large part to the unraveling of its partnership with USAA.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • AMRN

    Shares of Amarin (AMRN -2.2%) slip out of the gate this morning, possibly on cautious comments...

    Shares of Amarin (AMRN -2.2%) slip out of the gate this morning, possibly on cautious comments out of Summer Street. The firm says Vascepa doesn't have data to support superiority compared to other fish oils such as Lovaza by Glaxo SmithKline (GSK -0.6%) which third party payers are likely to favor.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 7 Comments
  • FRAN

    Shares of Francesca's (FRAN +1.9%) rise after the retailer records a better-than-expected Q3...

    Shares of Francesca's (FRAN +1.9%) rise after the retailer records a better-than-expected Q3 profit and boosts FY12 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • WFT

    Weatherford (WFT +3.5%) is attractive on fundamentals and as an acquisition candidate, Dahlman...

    Weatherford (WFT +3.5%) is attractive on fundamentals and as an acquisition candidate, Dahlman Rose writes. The firm believes WFT's core product lines, global presence and multinational tax structure would be attractive to a number of companies, and the current stock price could make WFT vulnerable to an unfriendly offer. HAL and GE could be interested.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • JRCCQ

    James River Coal's (JRCC -6.2%) credit rating is cut to Caa1 from B3 by Moody’s, which...

    James River Coal's (JRCC -6.2%) credit rating is cut to Caa1 from B3 by Moody’s, which cites falling prices, higher mining costs and increased regulatory scrutiny. Moody’s also says JRCC’s repurchase last month of $61M for $0.39 on the dollar qualifies as a “limited default" under the ratings company’s criteria.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC +2.2%) takes out a new 52-week high, rising on back of the Citigroup's plan...

    Bank of America (BAC +2.2%) takes out a new 52-week high, rising on back of the Citigroup's plan to cut 11K jobs. Citi will take a $1B charge in Q4, but save more than $2B over two years - a pretty nice return on investment. The XLF +0.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM | 11 Comments
  • AKG

    Keegan Resources (KGN -2.5%) and PMI Gold (OTC:PMVGF) agree to merge, forming a new West African...

    Keegan Resources (KGN -2.5%) and PMI Gold (OTC:PMVGF) agree to merge, forming a new West African gold development company that will operate as Asanko Gold. The new entity expects a boost in near-term production from a unitized project comprised of nearby Obotan and Esaase gold deposits.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharma (PPHM) +17.1% premarket after reaching agreement with the FDA on the design of...

    Peregrine Pharma (PPHM) +17.1% premarket after reaching agreement with the FDA on the design of a Phase III trial of its Cotara treatment for recurrent brain cancer. Cotara is a targeted therapy that delivers a high dose of radiation directly into the brain tumor while sparing radiation exposure to healthy brain tissue.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures maintain their gains despite the ADP report missing expectations,...

    Market preview: Stock futures maintain their gains despite the ADP report missing expectations, with commentary that the number would have been higher had it not been for Superstorm Sandy perhaps keeping the mood positive. The S&P benchmark is +0.25%. Comments out of China that the new government will maintain easy policies is also supposedly helping. Freeport McMoRan craters 13.9% on news that it's acquiring Plains Exploration (+25%) and McMoran Exploration (+15.2%). Later: Factory Orders, ISM Non-Manufacturing Index
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • C

    Michael Corbat continues to make his mark at Citigroup (NYSE:C) as the bank plans job cuts of...

    Michael Corbat continues to make his mark at Citigroup (NYSE:C) as the bank plans job cuts of more than 11K leading to savings of $900M in 2013, and more than $1.1B in 2014. Revenues are expected to take a $300M hit. CFO John Gerspach is scheduled to present at the Goldman investor conference later today. Shares +2.5% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • MMR

    Premarket gainers: MMR +77%. PXP +25%. PPHM +21%. CIE +13%. UEPS +12%. OCZ +10%. FRAN +9%. SSRI...

    Premarket gainers: MMR +77%. PXP +25%. PPHM +21%. CIE +13%. UEPS +12%. OCZ +10%. FRAN +9%. SSRI +9%. EXXI +8%. TEA +7%.
    Losers: CHTP -31%. MFRM -20%. MIND -17%. P -15%. FCX -14%. TIBX -13%. JRCC -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • FCX

    It's official: Freeport McMoRan (NYSE:FCX) will acquire Plains Exploration (NYSE:PXP) for ~$6.9B...

    It's official: Freeport McMoRan (NYSE:FCX) will acquire Plains Exploration (NYSE:PXP) for ~$6.9B in cash and stock, and acquire McMoRan Exploration (NYSE:MMR) for ~$3.4B in cash, or $2.1B net of 36% of the MMR interests currently owned by FCX and PXP. MMR +74.3%, PXP +25.2%, FXC -13.2% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM | 15 Comments
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +7.9%) edge higher in premarket trading, up 0.9%,...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +7.9%) edge higher in premarket trading, up 0.9%, as nothing alarming over competitive pressure has flowed out of the Starbucks Investor Conference (recaps: I, II) just yet.     More from the Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) Investor Conference (previous early recap): 1) More...

    More from the Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) Investor Conference (previous early recap): 1) More Evolution Fresh products in stores and grocery outlets are on tap. 2) Why Teavana? Tea is a $40B category with double-digit growth, according to execs. The growth potential is to bring the Teavana brand out of the malls and into the massive Starbucks street presence. A test run of a Tazo retail store showed upside potential. 3) Starbucks will sell La Boulange food in grocery stores as it looks to benefit from the bakery purchase. 4) No further acquisition plans in place, as Schultz says the firm is "full up." SBUX +1.2% premarket. (webcast)

    Subscribers at China Mobile (NYSE:CHL), the country's largest cellular operator, will be able to order Nokia's (NYSE:NOK) Windows 8 based Lumia 920T by the end of the month for 4,599 yuan ($739) without a contract. That's a bit later than the November launch that was initially envisaged, although it still beats Apple to the punch, as China Mobile doesn't yet carry an iPhone. Nokia jumps 6% in Helsinki.
